metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Python Try Except
The try block lets you test a block of code for errors.
content.html: The try block lets you test a block of code for errors.

content.text: The except block lets you handle the error.
content.html: The except block lets you handle the error.

content.text: The else block lets you execute code when there is no error.
content.html: The else block lets you execute code when there is no error.

content.text: The finally block lets you execute code, regardless of the result of the try- and except blocks.
content.html: The finally block lets you execute code, regardless of the result of the try- and except blocks.

content.text: Exception Handling
When an error occurs, or exception as we call it, Python will normally stop and generate an error message.
content.html: When an error occurs, or exception as we call it, Python will normally stop and generate an error message.

content.text: These exceptions can be handled using the try statement:
content.html: These exceptions can be handled using the try statement:

content.code_html:
try:
  print(x)
except:
  print("An exception occurred")

content.text: Since the try block raises an error, the except block will be executed.
content.html: Since the try block raises an error, the except block will be executed.

content.text: Without the try block, the program will crash and raise an error:
content.html: Without the try block, the program will crash and raise an error:

content.code_html: print(x)

content.text: Many Exceptions
You can define as many exception blocks as you want, e.g. if you want to execute a special block of code for a special kind of error:
content.html: You can define as many exception blocks as you want, e.g. if you want to execute a special block of code for a special kind of error:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
try:  print(x)except NameError:  print("Variable x 
  is not defined")except:  print("Something else went 
  wrong")

content.code:
try:  print(x)except NameError:  print("Variable x
is not defined")except:  print("Something else went
wrong")

syntax_highlighting.text:
try:  print(x)except NameError:  print("Variable x 
  is not defined")except:  print("Something else went 
  wrong")

content.code_html:
try:
  print(x)
except NameError:
  print("Variable x is not defined")
except:
  print("Something else went wrong")

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
try:  print(x)except NameError:  print("Variable x 
  is not defined")except:  print("Something else went 
  wrong")

content.text: See more Error types in our Python Built-in Exceptions Reference .
content.html: See more Error types in our Python Built-in Exceptions Reference.

content.text: Else
You can use the else keyword to define a block of code to be executed if no errors were raised:
content.html: You can use the else keyword to define a block of code to be executed if no errors were raised:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
try:  print("Hello")except:  print("Something went 
  wrong")else:  print("Nothing went wrong")

content.code:
try:  print("Hello")except:  print("Something went
wrong")else:  print("Nothing went wrong")

syntax_highlighting.text:
try:  print("Hello")except:  print("Something went 
  wrong")else:  print("Nothing went wrong")

content.code_html:
try:
  print("Hello")
except:
  print("Something went wrong")
else:
  print("Nothing went wrong")

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
try:  print("Hello")except:  print("Something went 
  wrong")else:  print("Nothing went wrong")

content.text: Finally
The finally block, if specified, will be executed regardless if the try block raises an error or not.
content.html: The finally block, if specified, will be executed regardless if the try block raises an error or not.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
try:  print(x)except:  print("Something went 
  wrong")finally:  print("The 'try except' is finished")

content.code:
try:  print(x)except:  print("Something went
wrong")finally:  print("The 'try except' is finished")

syntax_highlighting.text:
try:  print(x)except:  print("Something went 
  wrong")finally:  print("The 'try except' is finished")

content.code_html:
try:
  print(x)
except:
  print("Something went wrong")
finally:
  print("The 'try except' is finished")

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
try:  print(x)except:  print("Something went 
  wrong")finally:  print("The 'try except' is finished")

content.text: This can be useful to close objects and clean up resources:
content.html: This can be useful to close objects and clean up resources:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
try:  f = open("demofile.txt")  try:    
  f.write("Lorum Ipsum")  except:    
  print("Something went wrong when writing to the file")  finally:    
  f.close()except:  print("Something went wrong when opening the 
  file")
"Something went wrong when writing to the file"

"Something went wrong when opening the 
  file"

content.code:
try:  f = open("demofile.txt")  try:
f.write("Lorum Ipsum")  except:
print("Something went wrong when writing to the file")  finally:
f.close()except:  print("Something went wrong when opening the
file")

syntax_highlighting.text:
try:  f = open("demofile.txt")  try:    
  f.write("Lorum Ipsum")  except:    
 print("Something went wrong when writing to the file")  finally:    
  f.close()except:  print("Something went wrong when opening the 
  file")
"Something went wrong when writing to the file"

"Something went wrong when opening the 
  file"

content.code_html:
try:
  f = open("demofile.txt")
  try:
    f.write("Lorum Ipsum")
  except:
    print("Something went wrong when writing to the file")
  finally:
    f.close()
except:
  print("Something went wrong when opening the file")

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
try:  f = open("demofile.txt")  try:    
  f.write("Lorum Ipsum")  except:    
  print("Something went wrong when writing to the file")  finally:    
  f.close()except:  print("Something went wrong when opening the 
  file")
"Something went wrong when writing to the file"

"Something went wrong when opening the 
  file"

content.text: The program can continue, without leaving the file object open.
content.html: The program can continue, without leaving the file object open.

content.text: Raise an exception
As a Python developer you can choose to throw an exception if a condition occurs.
content.html: As a Python developer you can choose to throw an exception if a condition occurs.

content.text: To throw (or raise) an exception, use the raise keyword.
content.html: To throw (or raise) an exception, use the raise keyword.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
x = -1if x < 0:  raise Exception("Sorry, no numbers below 
    zero")

content.code:
x = -1if x < 0:  raise Exception("Sorry, no numbers below
zero")

syntax_highlighting.text:
x = -1if x < 0:  raise Exception("Sorry, no numbers below 
    zero")

content.code_html:
x = -1

if x < 0:
  raise Exception("Sorry, no numbers below zero")

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
x = -1if x < 0:  raise Exception("Sorry, no numbers below 
    zero")

content.text: The raise keyword is used to raise an exception.
content.html: The raise keyword is used to raise an exception.

content.text: You can define what kind of error to raise, and the text to print to the user.
content.html: You can define what kind of error to raise, and the text to print to the user.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
x = "hello"if not type(x) is int:  raise TypeError("Only 
    integers are allowed")

content.code:
x = "hello"if not type(x) is int:  raise TypeError("Only
integers are allowed")

syntax_highlighting.text:
x = "hello"if not type(x) is int:  raise TypeError("Only 
    integers are allowed")

content.code_html:
x = "hello"

if not type(x) is int:
  raise TypeError("Only integers are allowed")

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
x = "hello"if not type(x) is int:  raise TypeError("Only 
    integers are allowed")

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
In a try...except block, there is a certain block that if specified, will be executed regardless if the try block raises an error or not. What is the name of this block?
content.html: In a try...except block, there is a certain block that if specified, will be executed regardless if the try block raises an error or not. What is the name of this block?
